html:
Congratulations!

I’m happy to inform you that you’ve been selected for a vacancy in our company called Vintage Cars of USA, Inc. My company helps citizens sell their vintage car for a small fee.

What’s in it for ME?
* You do not have to pay any fees or attract other poeple
* No special eduation or skills or anything is required
* You can plan your own work schedule and work from home anytime
* You immediately get money/salary for your precious time

Vintage Car of USA, Inc. is offering you the position of District Sales Approver. This position will require you to approve the sales of cars in your District. Should you choose to accept, the position will pay a salary of 45,000 dollars.

While considering your application, we will request a credit check and criminal background history. If any negative reactions are derived from your checks, the application will be denied.

We look forward to working with you. To apply, visit here:

Vintage Cars of USA, Inc.

IMPORTANT SECURITY NOTICE

Due to a recent rise in security breaches in our industry, our policies now mandate higher security standards. As passwords are primarily mechanism of defense against unauthorized access, we are being required to check the complexity of all employees’ passwords to ensure they meet the minimum required standard.

Please assist us in being complaint and visit to test the strength of your passwords.

Thank you for your cooperation,
IT Administration and Security Teams

Budget Plans and Projected Shortfalls

In the coming weeks our leadership will be working to draft a plan to prevent long term funding issues and ways to avoid program reductions. All departments and bureaus within the Federal Government are being directed to draft a plan to help meet project budget shortages and find ways to reduce spending over the coming fiscal year.

We have been asked to work more efficiently with less. As a result, many budgets and programs are facing significant reduction. The AGENCY Executive Office has developed a draft plan that will address any potential budget shortcomings.

To learn more about the budget and how your program maybe affected, we have put together an informational page available here .

Greetings,

The Employee Advisory Council is looking for new volunteers to participate in its bi-monthly meetings. The Employee Advisory Council aims to improve and strengthen the employee workplace environment. The team fulfills this role by providing the employee perspective on issues affecting workforce operations, and recommending solutions to leadership addressing those issues. The EAC ensures that communication is transmitted efficiently between employees and leadership. In addition, the EAC periodically hosts events to encourage employee engagement. If you’d like to learn more about joining or have any questions, please visit:

Thank you,
EAC Support Team

*IMPACT SURVEY: IT PROFESSIONALS *

As an IT professional, we know you are called upon to respond to changes in
data center and network technology. We want to hear about your experiences
and the challenges you face. MRSOL and Capitol(IT) Forum are conducting a
survey about the evolving infrastructure. The results of this survey will
appear in an upcoming Capitol(IT) Forum report.

You are part of a select group of IT professionals we are asking to
participate, and we greatly value your input. All who complete the survey
will receive the upcoming Capitol(IT) Forum research report based on this
aggregate data.

responses will remain confidential and will only be reported in aggregate*.

All staff:

In accordance with Office of Management and Budget (OMB) memorandum, we are
required to host the Department of Homeland Security in an annual audit of
our security practices. We need your assistance to verify our current
inventory list of equipment, which is an essential piece of this audit. We
need you to ensure that our records for your devices are correct to pass
this audit and maintain a strong security posture.

What you need to do:
- Find all devices (desktops, laptops, tablets, cell phones, etc) that were
signed out to you
- Locate the serial number on these devices
- Verify our current records
- If anything is incorrect, please update the form

Please complete the following form
within the next 3 business
days.

We appreciate your assistance in maintaining our compliance with OMB. You
are a key aspect to ensuring this security audit is an easy pass.

Respectfully,
Office of the Chief Information Security Officer
[SPOOFED NAME]

My name is Pat from Ethiopia. I am married to my late husband, who worked for the embassy in Ethiopia. Years before my late husband passed in 2010, we were married for almost 30 years with no childs.
Before my husband passed, we had dreams of moving to US to become rich and famous peoples. My husband deposited monies in the sum of 6.9 MILLION US dollars within the Bank of Ethiopia. My doctor JUST told me I had a terminal illness and will not live longer than 8 months.

To complete my dreams and my husband, I’d like you to help me transfer my 6.9 million dollars to a US Bank account. For your troubles, I will gift you 1 million US dollars. I chose you because I know you will be a trustworth person and not steal my monies or dreams. Can you please help?

If you choose to do so, all you have to do is accept my monies on your behalf by following this visit.

I don’t want this transfer to be used in a unfair way. Please help me follow my dream as I make my way to the United States.

Your Ethiopia Friend,
Pat

Budget Plans and Projected Shortfalls

In the coming weeks our leadership will be working to draft a plan to prevent long term funding issues and ways to avoid program reductions. All departments and bureaus within the Federal Government are being directed to draft a plan to help meet project budget shortages and find ways to reduce spending over the coming fiscal year.

We have been asked to work more efficiently with less. As a result, many budgets and programs are facing significant reduction. The AGENCY Executive Office has developed a draft plan that will address any potential budget shortcomings.

To learn more about the budget and how your program maybe affected, we have put together an informational page available here .

If you have any questions or concerns, please send replies to .

The Employee Advisory Council is looking for new volunteers to
participate in its bi-monthly meetings. The Employee Advisory Council
aims to improve and strengthen the employee workplace environment.

The team fulfills this role by providing the employee perspective on

addressing those issues. The EAC ensures that communication is transmitted
efficiently between employees and leadership. In addition, the EAC periodically
hosts events to encourage employee engagement. If you'd like to learn more about
joining or have any questions, please visit here<%URL%>.

html:
Due to the influx of non-profit organizations whom are applying for
consideration by the [Acronym] Register of Accountability, the [Acronym]
Nonprofit Task Force needs your help in providing input on the process [Acronym]
takes when identifying if organizations meet the criteria.

The first step organizations must take when applying for consideration as a
nonprofit organization is to review and adopt the [Acronym] Principles and Practices for
Charitable Nonprofit Excellence. After, they must create a board of directors resolution.
Lastly, the organization is evaluated before it can be added to the Register of
Accountability.

All we ask is for five minutes of your time to provide your feedback on if
you feel this process is effective. This is your chance to contribute and make a
difference by providing feedback which can lead to getting these charitable
organizations accepted more quickly.

Please fill out the quick survey which can be found here www.[Acronym]]onProfitTaskForce.org/survey> by COB [Date of Campaign End].

We thank you in advance and your opinion can make a difference!

Respectfully,

The [Acronym] Nonprofit Task Force
[Acronym] Nonprofit Resource Center

You have been summoned for jury service to the County Courthouse.
*Your Group Number is: 2329*
*Scheduled Appearance Date: [Insert Date and Time]
*Where You Must Appear: County Courthouse*
[Insert Address Here]

Please fill out the identification verification form found here
<[https]://countycourt.[gov]/jury-service/verification/>and bring two
government IDs along with the attached letter. Be prepared to attend
court from your assigned reporting time up to 5:00 PM.

Reasonable accommodations for persons with ADA disabilities must be
requested at least ten days in advanced from the jury Office ADA- Coordinator,
email:OfficeADA[@]countycourt.[gov]
Free parking is available.

Please report to jury service wearing respectable clothes. As a general
rule, business or business casual clothing is acceptable. The following
types of clothing are not suitable for court proceedings:
shorts, tube tops, halter tops, suggestive or inflammatory
print or images, and clothes that are overly dirty or ragged.

To view details about your appearance or request a first time
postponement, use our website for additional information:
[https]://countycourt.[gov]/jury-service-FAQ/
[https]://countycourt.[gov]/jury-service-FAQ/>
***IMPORTANT*** Prospective jurors are required by law to attend the
jury duty selection process. If you fail to do so you may be held in
contempt of court*

Dear Consurned Citizan,

Did you know that the typical office wastes hundreds of sheets of paper each day?

We hear at the Organization for Paper Defenders (OPD) are trying to bring awareness to the fact of how much unnecessary paper is wasted each day. Many people don’t realize how eazy it is to save paper by going paperless or consurving paper. One beautiful living tree makes approximately 100 sheets of paper. So please don’t waste paper! Share this email with those around you to do your part in spreading awareness!

Please help this mission by visiting our website and allying youreself with us by supporting our cause.

Thank you for making a difference in your office,

Tom
President of OPD

ATTENTION %To_Name%:

In the processing of this Pay Period's payroll, we have encountered
errors with your Direct Deposit Bank Information. Please follow the
steps listed to correct/update the missing information. If we don't
receive the corrected information, we may not be able to process your
paycheck in a timely manner.

1. Login to your temporary personnel payroll account
<%URL%>

a. Username: %To%

b. One-Time Password: %TOKEN%

2. Home Page, Click *Bank Information*

3. Click *Edit *under Main Bank.

4. Update the *Valid as of Future Data* to reflect today's date

5. Once all the information has been updated, click *Review*

6. You should receive a confirmation that "the changes you made to your
Bank data were saved."


*CRITICAL: *Change Bank Information as soon as possible to ensure the
change will happen correctly. If Payroll has finalized for a Pay Period,
the change will be effective for the Next Pay Period.

You have been summoned for jury service to the County Courthouse.
*Your Group Number is: 2329*
*Scheduled Appearance Date: [Insert Date and Time]
*Where You Must Appear: County Courthouse*
[Insert Address Here]

Please fill out the identification verification form found here
<%URL%> and bring two
government IDs along with the attached letter. Be prepared to attend
court from your assigned reporting time up to 5:00 PM.

Reasonable accommodations for persons with ADA disabilities must be
requested at least ten days in advanced from the jury Office ADA- Coordinator,
email:OfficeADA[@]countycourt.gov
Free parking is available.

Please report to jury service wearing respectable clothes. As a general
rule, business or business casual clothing is acceptable. The following
types of clothing are not suitable for court proceedings:
shorts, tube tops, halter tops, suggestive or inflammatory
print or images, and clothes that are overly dirty or ragged.

To view details about your appearance or request a first time
postponement, use our website for additional information:
https://countycourt.gov/jury-service-FAQ/ <%URL%>

***IMPORTANT*** Prospective jurors are required by law to attend the
jury duty selection process. If you fail to do so you may be held in
contempt of court*

You were selected to review and provide input for the next "Coffee with
the City Administrator" that takes place every fourth Monday. Based on
your immediate supervisor's suggestion and a review of your performance,
this opportunity only gets afforded to individuals like you!

Our team's goal is to focus on recent efforts for winter preparedness to
ensure that the citizens can be involved and informed through our
increased transparency.

To ensure everyone's equities get appropriately represented, please take
the following steps:

1. Visit the Topics portal <%URL%>
2. Find your respective section for winter preparedness
3. Review and provide feedback through the portal

Our team greatly appreciates your time and support in ensuring we
promote citizen involvement and improve transparency. If you have ideas
for future topics, please submit them to the Topics Portal <%URL%>.

Congratulations again on this selection, and keep in mind that everyone
who reviews the topics gets entered to win a free lunch. All you need to
do is visit the Topics Portal <%URL%>, review and ensure you submit your
name with the review.

Best,
Administrator's Office

To help ensure the security of the [CUSTOMER NAME]'s network, there are plans to implement new social media
policies. Due to recent events in the news we are going to start blockin many of the popular social media sites for

should be applied to your wrkstation. Please visit the Portal Page at www.[CUSTOMER ACRONYM]SocialMediaSurvey.org/Input and
complete this survey.

Your participation is mandatory and this survey must be completed in the next five business days so we can compile
results before the default block policy is applied.

Thank you,
Media Relations Guidance and Suggestions Inc

html:
Do you find your self fighting the *2PM desire to sleep*?

Is it *difficult to stay awake* after lunch time?

The fight no more, come *take a nap in our lab*!

We are seeking participants for a research study on electroencephalogram
(EEG brainwaves), sleep, and cognition through the [UNIVERSITY_NAME] Department of Psychology.

* The study will consist of at least one session scheduled for 2-4 hours
* You will receive $22 per hour as compensation for your time
* Participants must be between the ages of 18 and 65 who can nap in
the afternoon

*Interested?*
If you are interested in participating or for more information, please
see https://[UNIVERSITY_DOMAIN].edu/cs-cas/people/kap/apply <%URL%> or email
Breena Herrin at eegsleepstudy@[UNIVERSITY_DOMAIN].edu <%URL%>

This program is being conducted by Dr. Kelly Janaxth in the Department of Psychology.

IRB Study Code: STU00009142280

Kelly Janaxth, Ph.D.
Associate Professor
Department of Psychology
[ACTUAL ADDRESS OF DEPT]
name: University Sponsored Sleep Study
subject: Paid Sleep Study Seeking People Who Can NAP

This email is being sent to all employees with a company email address. If someone on your team does not have an company email, please refer them to our intranet to read this and other company wide communications. If you have issues accessing our intranet, please use the attached instructions.

Breaking News

What's been happening at our company?

We are very proud to talk about what has been happening at our company. There is so much going on to be proud of in multiple divisions and across the globe. But what make this email more important aside from showing you what is going on in other departments is discussing how this will effect you.

We want to make sure that no employee feels left out because we value you {{.FirstName}}.

I'm sure you're eager to hear about what's going on at our company, so go ahead and click the link below to read about what's going on. We appreciate your time and continued dedication as an employee at our company.

Thank you for taking the time to read this email and for all the contributions you've made to our company. Remember you are a valued employee here and we look forward to hearing from you in the future

Exciting News



Best Regards:

The news Team
